questiontext.text:
Complete GDP income approach analysis for British Columbia during the strong economic expansion in Q1 2021.

Total GDP: {1:NUMERICAL:=2551.3:0.5} CAD billion

Net Taxes: {1:NUMERICAL:=286.8:0.5} CAD billion

Real GDP: {1:NUMERICAL:=2579.7:0.5} CAD billion

GDP per capita: {1:NUMERICAL:=75706:100} CAD
Given the total GDP and other income components for Yukon in Q1 2023, calculate the missing component: Compensation of Employees (CE).
Calculate what percentage of GDP is represented by Compensation of Employees in Alberta during Q3 2022.
During the moderate economic growth in Ontario, calculate the Gross Operating Surplus as a percentage of GDP.
Calculate the Gross Mixed Income (self-employment and unincorporated business income) as a percentage of GDP for New Brunswick in Q4 2020.
Calculate the net taxes (taxes on production and imports minus subsidies) for Nunavut in Q2 2020.

Analyze the income distribution in Prince Edward Island during the economic slowdown in Q1 2020. Calculate the share of GDP for each major income component.

CE Share: {1:NUMERICAL:=54.2:0.1}%

GOS Share: {1:NUMERICAL:=22:0.1}%

GMI Share: {1:NUMERICAL:=8.4:0.1}%
Calculate the total GDP using the income approach for Yukon in Q1 2021 during a period of economic slowdown.

Complete GDP income approach analysis for British Columbia during the strong economic expansion in Q3 2019.

Total GDP: {1:NUMERICAL:=2439.3:0.5} CAD billion

Net Taxes: {1:NUMERICAL:=264.7:0.5} CAD billion

Real GDP: {1:NUMERICAL:=2393.8:0.5} CAD billion

GDP per capita: {1:NUMERICAL:=62069:100} CAD
Calculate what percentage of GDP is represented by Compensation of Employees in Alberta during Q2 2022.
During the moderate economic growth in Newfoundland and Labrador, calculate the Gross Operating Surplus as a percentage of GDP.
Calculate the Gross Mixed Income (self-employment and unincorporated business income) as a percentage of GDP for Northwest Territories in Q2 2020.
